author: Siobhan Hughes
title: In West Virginia Senate Race, Victory for a Counter-Puncher Who Wasn’t on Ballot
text:
WASHINGTON—The Senate Republican leader, Mitch McConnell, had remained nearly silent as he absorbed the attacks from a West Virginia Senate candidate who taunted him as a “swamp captain” more focused on creating jobs for “China people” than helping Americans.
By Wednesday, the Kentucky Republican was ready to respond. After Don Blankenship, a former coal executive who served a year in prison after a deadly 2010 coal-mine explosion, lost a Republican primary contest that he tried to make a referendum on Mr. McConnell, a picture...
